description: Attested since 1880. Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek ἄφεσις (áphesis, “letting go”), from ἀφίημι (aphíēmi), from ἀπό (apó, “off”) + ἵημι (híēmi, “send forth”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics, prosody) The loss of the initial unstressed vowel of a word.
examples: The word "scarp" is derived from "escarp" by aphesis.
